intro: Gardenia pannea, commonly known as the Pernambuco gardenia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its flowers are usually 5 to 7 cm in diameter and bloom in summer. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
